title: Liability on bond, how enforced
context: [§641-32] Liability on bond, how enforced. [(a)] By entering into a bond for costs or to stay the execution of any proceedings to enforce a judgment, the surety submits oneself to the jurisdiction of the court, irrevocably appoints the clerk of the court as the surety&rsquo;s agent upon whom any papers affecting the surety&rsquo;s liability on the bond may be served, and agrees that the surety&rsquo;s liability may be enforced on motion without the necessity of an independent action. [(b)] The papers served on the clerk as statutory agent for the surety shall be mailed by the clerk to the surety if the surety&rsquo;s address is known. [L 1895, c 25, §4; RL 1925, §2540; RL 1935, §3508; RL 1945, §9510; RL 1955, §208-10; HRS §641-45; am L 1972, c 89, pt of §5; ren HRS §641-32; gen ch 1993]
